profile_positions.description:
2016: Master graduation internship with Besix Orascom Joint Venture (BOJV) at the Mall of Egypt, the same project and company as during my bachelor graduation internship. 

Subject:
Where before I was actively a part of the BOJV LEED team, this time the focus was on scientific research in the form of a case study. During 7 months I investigated the interactions and influences between international (cross-cultural) project management and the implementations of sustainability. Sustainability in the context of the research is limited to actions related to LEED. 
The reason for my research topic is that there is hardly any information available on the effects of cross-cultural management in international construction projects (such as the Mall of Egypt) implementing a sustainable certification scheme and the ways that incorporating these types of management can support the implementation of sustainable certification schemes. This led to the following research question: will the execution of international construction projects such as the MOE in Egypt benefit from taking cultural differences into account when drafting plans for LEED? The aim of the Thesis project is to provide BOJV with key issues in the execution of LEED projects in Egypt by incorporating cultural differences into the project sustainable certification process.
Currently I am in the final steps of writing the thesis.

Duties	
•	Observe the BOJV LEED team and the people they work with
•	Attend meetings of the BOJV LEED Team
•	Establish a timeline of LEED related actions at MOE, specified for BOJV
•	Review project documentation, drawings and uploaded documentation from LEED Online
•	Interview people on the project for their experiences with LEED
•	Meet with the BOJV LEED Consultant, the client and others for their thoughts on LEED at MOE
•	Attend site visits to inspect LEED related on site
•	Assist in writing reports & verifying specifications of materials

profile_positions.description:
2013: Graduation internship for Besix Orascom Joint Venture (BOJV), at the Mall of Egypt. 

Duties:	For half a year I supported the LEED team of BOJV. Activities included 
•	Check and verify assigned LEED Credits in contract specification versus details in drawings and forms in LEED Online and take corrective actions if necessary
•	Creating plans for LEED measurements on site (Waste management, Tabaco Smoke Control, Indoor Air Quality & Construction Activity Pollution Prevention)
•	Set up meetings with different teams on site who need to implement these plans to ensure correct implementation and to solve possible problems.
•	Site visits to inspect meeting LEED requirements & gathering evidence LEED Online
•	Verifying materials meeting requirements (recycled content, VOC content, regional materials & FSC wood)
•	Assist in subcontractors meeting LEED requirements
•	Create data tracker for Client, overview rapport usage on site
•	Assist in educational program to teach project team about LEED both in technical office and on site
•	Introduction presentation LEED at MOE for different Orascom projects starting LEED
•	Problem solving of all issues related to LEED

Description project:
This shopping mall houses the first indoor ski slope on the African continent. Besides a ski slope the Mall of Egypt will contain over 350 shops, a VOX Cinemas Cineplex and a Carrefour. With a gross leasable area of 165,000 square meters, this project is worth 6 billion EGP of investments and has to be build according to LEED. Leadership in Energy & Environmental Design (LEED) is a US green building certification program. LEED is well known because of its aim to be internationally applicable.

Companies involved in this project:
BOJV is the main contractor in this project on behalf of Majid Al Futtaim. Other partners include WSP | Parsons Brinkerhoff, MACE, MZECH, Shaker and RTKL UK Ltd.

profile_positions.description:
2012: A three months internship at the large Dutch building company BAM. My main assignment concerned project management within the housing reconstruction department, specifically the Active House Montfort. 

Duties	
•	One of my tasks was to assist my mentor in the management of this consortium; 
        o	Set up meetings between all parties of the consortium (including team building activities)
        o	Create presentations for the introduction of the Active House concept and the prospects of 		Active House Montfort
	o	Ensure all demands of the client and active housing concept are met, etc. 
•	Created a calculation document for sustainable insulation materials combined with data from 	Energy Performance calculations. This calculation sheet provides building specific investment- 	& return costs and the added value on the energy label of residential areas per material. 
•	Learned how to work with the programs AutoCAD & Sketchup in order to create project 	sketches
•	House visit for several renovation projects, performed an intake of the buildings and made the 	Energy Performance calculations in VABI.

Description project: 
The Active House project in Montfort was the first of its kind. Although the concept of active house is not a new concept, this was the first time that this concept was executed in a renovation project in the Netherlands. Ten residences from 1970 with an energy label E were renovated to a label A++. This entailed a 50% reduction of the energy demand.

Companies involved in this project:	
BAM W&R had the role of project management in a consortium that included VELUX group, Danfoss, GroenWest, Bouwhulpgroep & Nieman Raadgevende Ingenieurs.
